data.title: Who else was in Last Action Hero? (spoilers)
data.text:
Might be some spoilers but probably not.

Who else cameo-ed in LAH? I remembered the following anyone else see more?

Sharon Stone as Catherine the Icepick woman. the T-1000 Hammer (I still

call him M.C. Hammer) Maria Shriver as herself Arnold Swarcheneggar as

himself Danny Devito as the Cat's voice? (sounded like him to me) Sylvester

Stallone as the T-800 series Terminator (well, kind of)

That's all I can remember.

Oh yeah, the movie was a blast but I especially liked that babe cops in

leather pants. These two old women sitting to my left thought that was the

funniest thing in the whole movie and literally cackled when they heard me

say "I like leather."

- BK

<RHK...@psuvm.psu.edu> writes:

> Might be some spoilers but probably not.

> Who else cameo-ed in LAH? I remembered the following anyone else see more?

> Sharon Stone as Catherine the Icepick woman. the T-1000 Hammer (I still

> call him M.C. Hammer) Maria Shriver as herself Arnold Swarcheneggar as

> himself Danny Devito as the Cat's voice? (sounded like him to me) Sylvester

> Stallone as the T-800 series Terminator (well, kind of)

> That's all I can remember.

The teacher who was showing the Lawrence Olivier (sp?) film clip and

said 'you might remember him from the Kodak ad or as Zeus in

Clash of the Titans' was his widow.

The bad-guy's butler was the same guy as in the James Bond movie who

had a hat with a razor-blade rim and cut off the head of a statue.

Jim Belushi, Van-Damme (What did he say, anyway?), ?

[...]

> - BK

tomas.

--

"Nowhere is there an account or portrait of Christ laughing. . .he is

always stern, serious and as gloomy as a prison guard. Never does 1

see him laughing until tears appear in his eyes like the roly-poly

squint-eyed Buddha guffawing with arms upraised..." I.R.

In article <1993Jun20.2...@ucsu.colorado.edu> apo...@spot.Colorado.EDU (mu'tafikah) writes:

><RHK...@psuvm.psu.edu> writes:

>> Might be some spoilers but probably not.

>

>

>

>

>

>

>

>

>

>> Who else cameo-ed in LAH? I remembered the following anyone else see more?

>

>> Sharon Stone as Catherine the Icepick woman. the T-1000 Hammer (I still

>> call him M.C. Hammer) Maria Shriver as herself Arnold Swarcheneggar as

>> himself Danny Devito as the Cat's voice? (sounded like him to me) Sylvester

>> Stallone as the T-800 series Terminator (well, kind of)

>

>> That's all I can remember.

>

>The teacher who was showing the Lawrence Olivier (sp?) film clip and

>said 'you might remember him from the Kodak ad or as Zeus in

>Clash of the Titans' was his widow.

Joan Plowright

>

>The bad-guy's butler was the same guy as in the James Bond movie who

>had a hat with a razor-blade rim and cut off the head of a statue.

From Goldfinger....OddJob

>

>Jim Belushi, Van-Damme (What did he say, anyway?), ?

Leeeza Gibbons doing the interviews.

I would even count the Humvee as a cameo, though that one is a consumer

model, not his real army-issue Humvee.

I thought I caught Roger Ebert in the background at the premier...probably a

look alike since the camera never focused on him as it did with the other

cameos.

-Neal

<RHK...@psuvm.psu.edu> writes:

R6>Might be some spoilers but probably not.

[ ABORT! Abort! ...;) ]

R6>Who else cameo-ed in LAH? I remembered the following anyone else see more?

R6>Sharon Stone as Catherine the Icepick woman. the T-1000 Hammer (I still

R6>call him M.C. Hammer) Maria Shriver as herself Arnold Swarcheneggar as

R6>himself Danny Devito as the Cat's voice? (sounded like him to me) Sylvester

R6>Stallone as the T-800 series Terminator (well, kind of)

R6>That's all I can remember.

James Belushi and Jean Claude Van Damme (pretty sure he was at the

Slater IV premier...)
